body:
### Describe the bug

I ran into UBsan reporting undefined behavior in some code generated by Cython 3.2.3
<details>
<summary>output from pytest -vs</summary>

```

```

</details>

This is what the generated code looks like:
<details>
<summary>_cvodes.cpp line 11252 to 11277</summary>

```
    /* "View.MemoryView":419
 *         else:
 *             itemp = self.get_item_pointer(indices)
 *             return self.convert_item_to_object(itemp)             # <<<<<<<<<<<<<<
 * 
 *     def __setitem__(memoryview self, object index, object value):
*/
    __Pyx_XDECREF(__pyx_r);
    __pyx_t_2 = ((struct __pyx_vtabstruct_memoryview *)__pyx_v_self->__pyx_vtab)->convert_item_to_object(__pyx_v_self, __pyx_v_itemp); if (unlikely(!__pyx_t_2)) __PYX_ERR(1, 419, __pyx_L1_error)
    __Pyx_GOTREF(__pyx_t_2);
    __pyx_r = __pyx_t_2;
    __pyx_t_2 = 0;
    goto __pyx_L0;
  }
```
</details>

Sorry for not creating a MWE, if this is to unwieldy: feel free to close the issue. I found no current issues referencing `convert_item_to_object`, I found one which mentions ubsan:
- https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/3345#issue-560080288


### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

NIL

### Expected behaviour

_No response_

### OS

Linux

### Python version

3.13

### Cython version

3.2.3

### Additional context

_No response_

comment_data.body:
Thanks for the report.

We have these "called through the wrong function type" pretty much everywhere in Cython I'm afraid.

Essentially the pattern is that the first argument should really be a `PyObject *`, but instead we use `SomeCdefClassStruct *`. (The refactoring related to opaque objects and Python 3.15 Stable ABI improves this a bit, but not completely.)

If you want to use ubsan you'll just have to turn that check off. We've turned it off on our own ubsan testing.
I see, thank you for the prompt reply!

title: [BUG] UBsan triggered in genereated code for MemoryView
